ratings.comment: Amazing professor. Classic easy A class, but if you put in a little more you will get SO MUCH more out of it. VERY interesting class. Took for fun and loved it. Walter is available after class and loves questions and chatting. Truly a jem in a sea of terrible teachers. Absolute pleasure and an easy A, win-win. People in class usually suck though.

I took Professor Goodman's class during the summer for a requirement and I actually enjoyed it. He goes out of his way to provide extra readings that are short but super interesting and optional. He grades fairly and lets you know what to expect. He is also quite flexible when you have questions.
Great and very understanding professor. It's good to put in effort in the take home essays as the total of 5 essays make 45%

Five bug classification quizzes that you have to memorize some pictures for. One is dropped. Five fairly easy essays and you can decide which ones you do. Raise a bug where it does not matter if it dies, you can get a new one. Very easy class and very interesting lectures.
Easy class. Raise the bug and study for bug quizzes

Professor Goodman is an amazing researcher, lecturer, and person. People may not take this class seriously because "oh, we're raising a bug, cool".  I took this class as a senior, and I learned more than I have in many other coursers. Take it seriously, and it will be one of the most rewarding lectures of your college career.

Class is interesting.  Attendance is not mandatory, but you need to attend a good chunk of the lectures.  Professor cares about his work.  Do the first 5 essays as they are graded harder as the semester goes on and they are graded extremely objectionably.  AB guaranteed if you show up and go through the motions.
Easiest class ever. Hardly did anything and got an A. Just need to go to lecture to get pop quiz points and keep your bug alive. Super easy

This class is super easy, but be a little cautious because you need 96% to get an A - not that that's in any way difficult in this class. Nothing you're graded on is based on the lectures, so really you just need to show up to take attendance quizzes and maybe to turn in essays, etc. Prof Goodman is chill too.

Easiest class ever. Professor Goodman is obviously very passionate about what he teaches but paying attention is unneeded because the five essays you write and quizes you take have nothing to do with lecture. It is important to go to lecture to take "pop quizes" that you basically get full credit for just being there. Don't expect to learn anything
Easiest class ever, but don't expect to learn something from this class.

Just take him! Interesting class too! NO tests, just some attendance quizes ( piece of cake if you attend class), couple of 2 page papers and then you rear a bug ( which is FUN!) Overall, great prof- he really cares about the material too! DONT LET THE CLASS GET LOUD- he is a stickler on people being dead silent during his lecture! Take ENTO w/ him
Good professor, easy class. Even if you go in planning to sleep through lecture you may find it interesting enough that you want to pay attention.

Very generous. He'll let you get into the class although the timetable says full. Grades are A guaranteed as long as you write the essays, remember the insect names and keep your bug alive. Very friendly outside class. A bit moody sometimes: if you make noises he'll give you pop quiz
NO EXAMS! EASY CREDIT, AND U GET TO RAISE A BUG! I KILLED MINE AND HE DIDN'T MAKE ME START ALL OVER. HE GAVE ME ONE THAT WAS EVEN BIGGER. DO WHAT U WANT IN CLASS, JUST DON'T TALK!!
Easy class to get an A in, but Goodman is very moody.  Watch out if you get on his bad side ... he's crazy!

Professor Goodman is one hell of a teacher.  He makes you wanna pay attention and learn.  His class is also very interesting and fun.  An easy A, and the class and lecture are well worth it.  He's very funny and knowlegdeable.

Walter Goodman is a great prof. He's old, nice, and funny. He's good at getting his point across and he knows how to teach to his students. The class is super easy too...no exams, just a few short and simple quizzes. Take the class for a solid A.

I LOVE Walter Goodman. He is the nicest, funniest guy who makes even flesh-eating viruses seem funny. Also, I spent about 3 hours of time outside of the classroom doing work ALL SEMESTER! Easy (and fun) A!

The easiest A on campus, or at least easiest science credit. Very little work required to get an A and he says that there is no reason why everyone shouldnt get an A in his class. It is interesting to learn about bugs and the only downside of the class is that it is at night. Otherwise, take the cla
Very easy! no final, don't even need to pay attention in class.  If you show up and do what little work there is, easy A. Tries to make dry lectures entertaining-great class for bio credit.

He is a great guy and a good teacher. Very understanding, knows the way students think and is very accomodating. A stress-free prof, dislikes tests, VERY reasonable! If you want it, you get an A. Makes an effort to learn names!
